document_data.name: Gujj
document_data.mainbody:
'''Gujj''' was a [[Bhaalist]] [[doppelganger]] member of the [[Murder Tribunal]] in [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''How long do you think Master Pennygood expects us to wait? I'm bored already.''|Gujj in his human guise}}
document_data.Description: His his [[human]] guise, Gujj appeared to be an affluent, dusky man with long black hair. When the disguise was dropped, Gujj looked like the rest of his pale kin.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Gujj and several other doppelgangers accompanied a Bhaalist murderer [[Dolor]] to assassinate and mutilate the [[Figaro Pennygood]], the proprietor of the [[Facemaker's Boutique]] targeted by the church. In case unwanted eyes visited the store, Gujj played the role of an impatient customer who was in line to see the fabulous Figaro. Gujj was presumed killed by a group of adventurers known as the [[Absolute Adversaries]] who were investigating the series of murderers perpetrated by the Murder Tribunal.
